etymologies: early 19th century (as a musical term designating a system of tuning, characterized by equal intervals): from Greek isotonos, from isos ‘equal’ + tonos ‘tone’

definitions: (of muscle action) taking place with normal contraction.
shortDefinitions: (of muscle action) taking place with normal contraction

definitions: denoting or relating to a solution having the same osmotic pressure as some other solution, especially one in a cell or a body fluid.
shortDefinitions: denoting solution having same osmotic pressure as some other solution

definitions: (of a drink) containing essential salts and minerals in the same concentration as in the body and intended to replace those lost as a result of sweating during vigorous exercise.
shortDefinitions: containing essential salts and minerals in same concentration as in body
